english.segment1: We drove through misty canyons. Our destination seemed resolved. But through highbeams tragedy called
english.segment2: It seemed like a normal evening. We rode in silent walls between. Our wills, like guillotines
english.segment3: I sped on mountain roads as. Your words came piercing through my chest. I'm your usual suspect
english.segment4: I turned my head in defense. That's when I heard you crash
english.segment5: In siren screams like rival factions. Two stories are told. We never knew at any moment. We might just implode
english.segment6: They're watching you crashing into. Crashing into me. And wishing they had what we see. Had what we see. Had what we believe
english.segment7: We were magnetic fields when. We came together long ago. You glowed like burning halos
english.segment8: But we spent a lifetime on the. Beaches of Normandy in vain. What for I can't explain
english.segment9: I looked to you from the darkened highway. Facing you in tears. And in that moment, metal twisted. And you disappeared
english.segment10: They're watching you crashing into. Crashing into me. And wishing they had what we see. Had what we see. Had what we believe
english.segment11: A fatal evening's drive is what they always will assume. But I know better as I collide face first with you.
